member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Helper.SerialPortHelper
member.summary: Serial port helper class.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Helper.SerialPortHelper.SafeDisconnect(System.IO.Ports.SerialPort,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Safely closes a serial port and its internal stream even if a USB serial interface was physically removed from the system in a reliable manner.
member.remarks:
The class has 3 different problems in disposal in case of a USB serial device that is physically removed:
1. The eventLoopRunner is asked to stop and returns false. Upon disposal this property is checked and closing the internal serial stream is skipped, thus keeping the original handle open indefinitely (until the finalizer runs which leads to the next problem)
The solution for this one is to manually close the internal serial stream. We can get its reference by before the exception has happened or by reflection and getting the "internalSerialStream" field.
2. Closing the internal serial stream throws an exception and closes the internal handle without waiting for its eventLoopRunner thread to finish, causing an uncatchable ObjectDisposedException from it later on when the finalizer runs (which oddly avoids throwing the exception but still fails to wait for the eventLoopRunner).
The solution is to manually ask the event loop runner thread to shutdown (via reflection) and waiting for it before closing the internal serial stream.
3. Since Dispose throws exceptions, the finalizer is not suppressed.
The solution is to suppress their finalizers at the beginning.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Feature.SetPdpIpConnectionFeature
member.summary:
Create the Packet Data Protocol (PDP) IP based connection.
Command: AT+CGDCONT=<cid> [,<pdptype> [,<apn>[,<pdpaddr> [,<dcomp>[,<hcomp]]]]]
Response: OK | ERROR Command: AT+CGDCONT? Response: +CGDCONT: <cid1>,<pdptype1>,<apn1>,<pdpaddr1><dcomp1>,<hcomp1>, …, <cidN>,<pdptypeN>,<apnN>,<pdpaddrN><dcompN>
Command: AT+CGDCONT=? Response: +CGDCONT: (<cid_range>),<pdptype>,,,(<dcomp_range>),(<hcomp_range>)
Description: Allows configuration of one or several packet data protocol context which forms the base of a data connection. <cid> PDP context ID, minimum value is 1, maximum value depends on device and can be found with the =? command.
<pdptype> String parameter identifying the protocol type IP – Internet Protocol IPV6 – Internet Protocol, version 6 PPP – Point to Point Protocol
<apn> String that identifies the Access Point Name in the packet data network.
<pdpaddr> Requested address, if null (0.0.0.0) an address is requested dynamically.
<dcomp> PDP data compression control, off by default.
<hcomp> PDP header compression control, off by default.
> AT+CGDCONT=1,"IP","apn.net" OK
>AT+CGDCONT? +CGDCONT: 1,"IP","apn.net","0.0.0.0″,0,0
>AT+CGDCONT=? +CGDCONT: (1-16),"IP",,,(0-2),(0-4) +CGDCONT: (1-16),"PPP",,,(0-2),(0-4) +CGDCONT: (1-16),"IPV6″,,,(0-2),(0-4)

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Feature.UssdFeature
member.summary:
Sending USSD command to the network USSD stands for Unstrcutured Supplementary Services Data. It is a way of sending short commands from the mobile phone to the GSM network. It uses, like SMS, the signalling channel of the GSM connection. Unlike SMS, it does not use a store and forward architecture, but a session oriented connection. USSD text messages can be up to 182 bytes in length. Messages received on the mobile phone are not stored.
USSD is defined within the GSM standard in the documents:
GSM 02.90 (USSD Stage 1) GSM 03.90 (USSD Stage 2)
USSD is most used to make it easy for the (prepaid) mobile user to query his prepaid balance using his mobile phone. It can also be used in mobile payments systems and information services such as weather forecasts and traffic information.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Http.HttpGateway.Send(MessagingToolkit.Core.Base.IMessage)

summary.para: Send message to the device through HTTP POST method. If the message is going to be sent immediately (not scheduled to be sent later) the MessageSending event will NOT be triggered.
The MessageSent, MessageDelivered and MessageSendingFailed events will be triggered.

member.returns: true if successfully sent. If false then you need to check the last exception thrown

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Http.HttpGateway.GetMessageStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the message status.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Http.HttpGateway.SendToQueue(MessagingToolkit.Core.Base.IMessage)

summary.para: Send message through message queue to the device through HTTP POST method. The message queue will be processed in the background and message events will be triggered.

Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

summary.para: Send message to the device through HTTP POST method. If the message is going to be sent immediately (not scheduled to be sent later) the MessageSending event will NOT be triggered.
The event MessageSent, MessageDelivered and MessageSendingFailed will be triggered depending on the sending status.

member.returns: true if successfully sent. If false then you need to check the last exception thrown

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Http.IHttpGateway.SendToQueue(MessagingToolkit.Core.Base.IMessage)

summary.para: Send message through message queue to the device through HTTP POST method. The message queue will be processed in the background and message events will be triggered.
The event MessagingSending, MessageSent, MessageDelivered and MessageSendingFailed will be triggered depending on the sending status.

member.returns: true if successfully sent. If false then you need to check the last exception thrown

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.Mms.AddToAddress(System.String,MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.MmsAddressType)
member.summary: Adds a new receiver of the Multimedia Message. The message can have more than one receiver but at least one. param value is the string representing the address of the receiver. It has to be specified in the full format i.e.: +358990000005/TYPE=PLMN or joe@user.org or 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.Mms.AddCcAddress(System.String,MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.MmsAddressType)
member.summary: Adds a new receiver in the CC (Carbon Copy) field of the Multimedia Message. The message can have more than one receiver in the CC field. param value is the string representing the address of the CC receiver. It has to be specified in the full format i.e.: +358990000005/TYPE=PLMN or joe@user.org or 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.Mms.AddBccAddress(System.String,MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.MmsAddressType)
member.summary: Adds a new receiver in the BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) field of the Multimedia Message. The message can have more than one receiver in the BCC field.
member.param: value is the string representing the address of the BCC receiver. It has to be specified in the full format i.e.: +358990000005/TYPE=PLMN or joe@user.org or 1.2.3.4/TYPE=IPv4.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.MmsDeliveryNotification
member.summary: A MMS Delivery Report MUST be sent from the MMS Proxy -Relay to the originator MMS Client or the forwarding MMS Client when a delivery report has been requested and the recipient MMS Client has not explicitly requested for denial of the report. As for example, the recipient can request for denial of the Delivery Report by using the X-Mms- Report-Allowed field of M-Acknowledge.ind or M-NotifyResp.ind PDU. There will be a separate delivery report from each recipient. There is no response PDU to the delivery report.
member.code:
Field: X-Mms-Message-Type Value: Message-type-value = mdelivery-ind Description: Mandatory. Specifies the PDU type.
Field: X-Mms-MMS-Version Value:MMS-version-value Description: Mandatory. The MMS version number.
Field: Message-ID Value: Message-ID-value Description: Mandatory. This is the reference that was originally assigned to the MM by the MMS Proxy -Relay and included in the corresponding M-Send.conf or M-Forward.conf PDU. The ID enables an MMS Client to match delivery reports with previously sent or forwarded MMs.
Field: To Value: To-value Description: Mandatory. Needed for reporting in case of point-to-multipoint message.
Field: Date Value: Date-value Description: Mandatory.Date and time the message was handled (fetched, expired, etc.) by the recipient or MMS Proxy -Relay.
Field: X-Mms-Status Value: Status-value Description: Mandatory.The status of the message.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.MmsNotification
member.summary: A MMS notification is an indication on your mobile phone, that tells you that a new MMS message for you has arrived at the MMSC (Multimedia Message Service Centre)
member.code:
Depending on your phone's settings, it will automatically download the MMS message from the MMSC, if there is a GPRS or UMTS connection configured. The MMS notification message is encoded according to the MMS encapsulation protocol.
There are eight types of PDU's described in this protocol:
M-Send.req M-Send.conf GET.req M-Retrieve.conf M-Notification.ind M-NotifyResp.ind M-Delivery.ind M-Acknowledge.req
For MMS notification messages the 'M-Notification.ind' PDU is used. This PDU contains the following fields: Name Content Description X-Mms-Message-Type m-notification-ind specify the pdu type X-Mms-Transaction-ID Transaction-id-value Unique ID to identify the transaction X-Mms-MMS-Version MMS-version-value MMS Version: 1.0 From From-value Address of the sender, if left blank, this address will be added by the MMSC Subject Subject-value Optional: subject of the MMS message X-Mms-Message-Class Message-class-value Message Class: private, informational, advertising or auto X-Mms-Message-Size Message-size-value Size of the MMS message in bytes X-Mms-Expiry Expiry-value Expiration date of the MMS message on the MMSC X-Mms-Content-Location Content-location-value The location of the MMS message (for instance http://mmsc.com/mmsc/133/145a.mms)
Sample of a MMS notification message in binary encoding:
0x8C X-Mms-Message-Type 0x82 'm-notification-ind' 0x98 X-Mms-Transaction-ID 0x34 '4' 0x35 '5' 0x41 'A' 0x36 '6' 0x37 '7' 0x32 '2' 0x33 '3' 0x37 '7' 0x00 Terminating Zero 0x8D X-Mms-MMS-Version 0x90 '1.0' 0x89 From 0x0F FieldSize 0x80 Field is present ( 0x81 when no From address is specified ) 0x2B '+' 0x33 '3' 0x31 '1' 0x36 '6' 0x33 '3' 0x38 '8' 0x37 '7' 0x34 '4' 0x30 '0' 0x31 '1' 0x36 '6' 0x30 '0' 0x00 Terminating Zero 0x96 Subject 0x4D 'M' 0x4D 'M' 0x53 'S' 0x00 Terminating Zero 0x8A X-Mms-Message-Class 0x80 'Personal' 0x8E X-Mms-Message-Size 0x04 4 bytes 0x00 0x00 0x1E 0xD3 7891 Bytes 0x88 X-Mms-Expiry 0x06 Field Size 0x80 Absolute Date Format ( 0x81 = Relative Date Format ) 0x04 Size of Time field 0x45 0xA7 0xC3 0xB7 1168622519 Seconds from 1-1-1970 0x83 X-Mms-Content-Location 0x68 'h' 0x74 't' 0x74 't' 0x70 'p' 0x3A ':' 0x6D '/' 0x6D '/' ... 0x00 Terminating Zero
MMS Notifications provide the MMS Client with information (e.g. message class and expiry time) about a MM located at the recipient MMS Proxy -Relay and waiting for retrieval. The purpose of the notification is to allow the client to automatically fetch a MM from the location indicated in the notification. The transaction identifier is created by the MMS Proxy -Relay and is unique up to the following M-NotifyResp.ind only.
Note: If the MMS Notification is resent at a later point in time - prior to receiving a corresponding M-NotifyResp.ind - then this MMS Notification must be identical to the original MMS Notification. If the MMS Client requests deferred retrieval with M-NotifyResp.ind, the MMS Proxy -Relay MAY create a new transaction identifier.
Table 3 contains the field names, the field values and descriptions of the header fields of the M-Notification.ind PDU.
Field: X-Mms-Message-Type Value: Message-type-value = m-notification-ind Description: Mandatory. Specifies the PDU type.
Field: X-Mms-Transaction-ID Value: Transaction-id-value Mandatory. Description: This transaction ID identifies the M-Notification.ind and the corresponding M-NotifyResp.ind
Field: X-Mms-MMS-Version Value: MMS-version-value Description: Mandatory. The MMS version number
Field: From Value: From-value Optional. Description: Address of the last MMS Client that handled the MM, i.e. that sent or forwarded the MM. If hiding the address of the sender from the recipient is requested by the originating MMS Client and supported and accepted by the MMS Proxy -Relay, the MMS Proxy -Relay MUST NOT add this field to the M-Notification.ind PDU. The insert-address-token MUST NOT be used as the value of the field.
Field: Subject Value: Subject-value Description: Optional. Subject of the message.
Field: X-Mms-Delivery-Report Valule: Delivery-report-value Description: Optional. Specifies whether the user wants a delivery report from each recipient. The absence of the field does not indicate any default value.
Field: X-Mms-Message-Class Value: Message-class-value Description: Mandatory. Class of the message. The MMS Proxy -Relay M UST provide the Personal message class if the original submission did not include the X-Mms-Message-Class field.
Field: X-Mms-Message-Size Value: Message-size-value Description: Mandatory. Full size of the associated M-Retrieve.conf PDU in octets. The value of this header field could be based on approximate calculation, therefore it SHOULD NOT be used as a reason to reject the MM.
Field: X-Mms-Expiry Value: Expiry-value Description: Mandatory. Length of time the message will be available. The field has only one format, relative.
Field: X-Mms-Reply-Charging Value: Reply-charging-value Description: Optional. If this field is present its value is set to "accepted" or "accepted text only" and the MMS-version-value of the M-Notification.ind PDU is higher than 1.0, this header field will indicate that a reply to this particular MM is free of charge for the recipient. If the Reply-Charging service is offered and the request for reply-charging has been accepted by the MMS service provider the value of this header field SHALL be set to “accepted” or “accepted text only”.
Field: X-Mms-Reply-Charging-Deadline Value: Reply-chargingdeadline-value Description: Optional. This header field SHALL NOT be present if the X-Mms-Reply-Charging header field is not present. It SHALL only be interpreted if the value of X-Mms-Reply-Charging header field is set to ”accepted” or “accepted text only”. It specifies the latest time the recipient has to submit the Reply-MM. After this time the originator of the Original-MM will not pay for the Reply-MM any more.
Field: X-Mms-Reply-Charging-Size Value: Reply-charging-size-value Description: Optional. This header field SHALL NOT be present if the X-Mms-Reply-Charging header field is not present. It specifies the maximum size (number of octets) for the Reply-MM.
Field: X-Mms-Reply-Charging-ID Value: Reply-charging-ID value Description: Optional. This header field SHALL only be present in PDUs thatnotify a recipient about a Reply-MM. The value of this header field SHALL be the same as the Message-ID of the Original-MM that is replied to.
Field: X-Mms-Content-Location Value: Content-location-value Description: Mandatory. This field defines the location of the MM to be retrieved.
The M-Notification.ind PDU does not contain a message body. The standard URI format according to [RFC2396] SHALL be set as the Content-location-value, for example: http://mmsc/message-id

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.MmsReadReport
member.summary: There are two types of PDUs used for the handling of Read Reports. On the MM recipient side the M-Read-Rec.ind MUST be used and on the MM originating side the M-Read-Orig.ind MUST be used.
member.code:
M-Read-Rec PDU --------------
Field: X-Mms-Message-Type Value: m-read-rec-ind Mandatory. Description: Identifies the PDU type
Field: X-Mms-MMS-Version Value: MMS-version-value Description: Mandatory. The MMS version number
Field: Message-ID Value: Message-ID-value Description: Mandatory. This is the reference that was originally assigned to the MM by the MMS Proxy -Relay and included in the corresponding M-Send.conf or M-Forward.conf PDU. The ID enables an MMS Client to match read report PDUs with previously sent or forwarded MMs.
Field: To Value: To-value Description: Mandatory. The address of the recipient of the Read Report, i.e. the originator of the original multimedia message.
Field: From Value: From-value Description: Mandatory. Address of the sender of the Read Report. The sending client MUST send either its address or insert an address token. In case of token, the MMS Proxy -Relay MUST insert the correct address of the sender.
Field: Date Value: Date-value Description: Optional. Time the message was handled by the recipient MMS Client. Recipient MMS Proxy -Relay SHALL generate this field when not supplied by the recipient MMS Client.
Field: X-Mms-Read-Status Value: Read-status-value Description: Mandatory. The status of the message.
M-Read-Orig.ind PDU -------------------
Field: X-Mms-Message-Type Value: m-read-orig-ind Description: Mandatory.Identifies the PDU type
Field: X-Mms-MMS-Version Value: MMS-version-value Description: Mandatory.The MMS version number
Field: Message-ID Value: Message-ID-value Description: Mandatory. This is the reference that was originally assigned to the MM by the MMS Proxy -Relay and included in the corresponding M-Send.conf or M-Forward.conf PDU. The ID enables an MMS Client to match read report PDUs with previously sent or forwarded MMs.
Field: To Value: To-value Description: Mandatory. The address of the recipient of the Read Report, i.e. the originator of the original multimedia message.
Field: From Value: From-value Description: Mandatory. The address of the originator of the Read Report, i.e. the recipient of the original multimedia message. The insert-address-token MUST NOT be used as the value of the field.
Field: Date Value: Date-value Description: Mandatory. Time the message was handled by the recipient MMS Client.
Field: X-Mms-Read-Status Value: Read-status-value Descripition: Mandatory. The status of the message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.vCalendar.TimeZone
member.summary:
Gets or sets the time zone. This property is identified by the property name TZ. This property specifies the standard time zone of the "home" system that created the vCalendar object. The property value is specified in a manner consistent with ISO 8601. The property value is a signed numeric indicating the number of hours and possibly minutes from UTC. Time zones east of UTC are positive numbers. Time zones west of UTC are negative numbers.
The following are examples of this property: TZ:-05 TZ:+05:30 Support for this property is optional for implementations conforming to this specification.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.vEvent.RecurrenceRule
member.summary:
Gets or sets the recurrence rule.
This property is identified by the property name RRULE. This property defines a rule or repeating pattern for a recurring vCalendar entity, based on the Basic Recurrence Rule Grammar of XAPIA's CSA. The value for the property is a pattern specification for the recurrence. The following is an example of this property:
W2 TU TH Every other week, on Tuesday and Thursday D1 #10 Daily for 10 occurrences YM1 6 7 #8 Yearly in June and July for 8 occurrences
Support for this property is optional for implementations conforming to this specification.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.Message.vCard
member.summary: vCard message

Container class for vCard properties of vCard 2.1. Considering current implementation of vCard support in MS Outlook, MS Outlook Express, Yahoo Mail and Eudora etc., the following properties and attributes are not supported: * Photo * Address labels * Delivery address types * Mailer * Timezone * EMail types * Sound * Public key * Extensions * Geo
So this vCard implementation is expected to be compatible with standard vCard fields of the vCard generated by these programs.

member.summary: MMS-version-value = Short-integer The three most significant bits of the Short-integer are interpreted to encode a major version number in the range 1-7, and the four least significant bits contain a minor version number in the range 0-14. If there is only a major version number, this is encoded by placing the value 15 in the four least significant bits [WAPWSP].

member.summary: Enum representing the status of a GSM Unstructured Supplemental Service Data (USSD) data coding schemd (DCS).

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.UssdDcs.LanguageInPrefix7Bit
member.summary: Bits 3..0 0000: GSM 7 bit default alphabet; message preceded by language indication. The first 3 characters of the message are a two-character representation of the language encoded according to ISO 639 [12], followed by a CR character. The CR character is then followed by 90 characters of text.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.UssdDcs.LanguageInPrefixUcs2
member.summary: UCS2 - message preceded by language indication The message starts with a two GSM 7-bit default alphabet character representation of the language encoded according to ISO 639 [12]. This is padded to the octet boundary with two bits set to 0 and then followed by 40 characters of UCS2-encoded message. An MS not supporting UCS2 coding will present the two character language identifier followed by improperly interpreted user data.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.BaseMobileGateway`1.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.PortHandshake
member.summary: Handshaking protocol for serial port transmission of data

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.PortHandshake.None
member.summary: No control is used for the handshake

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.PortHandshake.RequestToSendXOnXOff
member.summary: Both the Request-to-Send (RTS) hardware control and the XON/XOFF software controls are used

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.PortHandshake.XOnXOff
member.summary: The XON/XOFF software control protocol is used. The XOFF control is sent to stop the transmission of data. The XON control is sent to resume the transmission. These software controls are used instead of Request to Send (RTS) and Clear to Send (CTS) hardware controls

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.PortHandshake.RequestToSend
member.summary: Request-to-Send (RTS) hardware flow control is used. RTS signals that data is available for transmission. If the input buffer becomes full, the RTS line will be set to false. The RTS line will be set to true when more room becomes available in the input buffer.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.MessageStatusReportStatus
member.summary:
Message status report status
0x00 Short message delivered successfully 0x01 Forwarded, but status unknown 0x02 Replaced 0x20 Congestion, still trying 0x21 Recipient busy, still trying 0x22 No response recipient, still trying 0x23 Service rejected, still trying 0x24 QOS not available, still trying 0x25 Recipient error, still trying 0x40 RPC Error 0x41 Incompatible destination 0x42 Connection rejected 0x43 Not obtainable 0x44 QOS not available 0x45 No internetworking available 0x46 Message expired 0x47 Message deleted by sender 0x48 Message deleted by SMSC 0x49 Does not exist

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.IMobileGateway.Send(MessagingToolkit.Core.Base.IMessage)
member.summary:
Send message synchronously. Since it is synchronous, message sending events will not be raised
Message can be - SMS, - EMS, - Flash SMS - vCard, - vCalendar - Wappush - Ringtone, - MMS
member.returns: true if successfully sent. If false then you need to check the last exception thrown

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Mobile.IMobileGateway.SendToQueue(MessagingToolkit.Core.Base.IMessage)
member.summary:
Send message asynchronously. Message sending events will be raised
Message can be - SMS, - EMS, - Flash SMS - vCard, - vCalendar - Wappush - Ringtone, - MMS
member.returns: true if successfully sent. If false then you need to check the last exception thrown

Path of the file to save the object to.

example.code:
SerializableObject serializableObject = new SerializableObject();
ObjectXmlSerializer<SerializableObject>.Save(serializableObject, "XMLObjects.xml", IsolatedStorageFile.GetUserStoreForAssembly(), new Type[] { typeof(MyCustomType) });

member.param: Serializable object to be saved to file.
Name of the file in the isolated storage area to save the object to.
Isolated storage area directory containing the XML file to save the object to.
Extra data types to enable serialization of custom types within the object.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS
member.summary: Defines the credential user interface flags.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.None
member.summary: No flags have been specified.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.IncorrectPassword
member.summary: Notify the user of insufficient credentials by displaying the 'Logon unsuccessful' balloon tip.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.DoNotPersist
member.summary: Do not store credentials or display check boxes. You can pass CREDUI_FLAGS_SHOW_SAVE_CHECK_BOX with this flag to display the Save check box only, and the result is returned in the pfSave output parameter.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.RequestAdministrator
member.summary: Populate the combo box with local administrators only.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.ExcludeCertificates
member.summary: Populate the combo box with user name/password only. Do not display certificates or smart cards in the combo box.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.RequireCertificate
member.summary: Populate the combo box with certificates and smart cards only. Do not allow a user name to be entered.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.ShowSaveCheckBox
member.summary: If the check box is selected, show the Save check box and return TRUE in the pfSave output parameter, otherwise, return FALSE. Check box uses the value in pfSave by default.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.Internal.NativeMethods.CREDUI_FLAGS.AlwaysShowUI
member.summary: Specifies that a user interface will be shown even if the credentials can be returned from an existing credential in credential manager. This flag is permitted only if CREDUI_FLAGS_GENERIC_CREDENTIALS is also specified.

member.summary: The remote access service (RAS) displays a terminal window for user input before dialing the connection.

member.summary: The remote access service displays a terminal window for user input after dialing the connection.
member.remarks: This member is only used when the entry is dialed by the component.

member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time (in seconds) before the connection attempt is aborted.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasDialer
member.summary: Provides an interface to the remote access service (RAS) dialer. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: Failure to dispose of this component may result in a connection attempt hanging, which will require the machine to be restarted before the connection is released.

When using RasDialer to dial connections asynchronously, ensure the SynchronizingObject property is set if thread synchronization is required. If this is not done, you may get cross-thread exceptions thrown from the component. This is typically needed with applications that have an interface, ie. Windows Forms or Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

If an exception occurs while processing an event while dialing asynchronously, that exception will be raised through the Error event on RasDialer. This approach allows the application to continue processing the notifications from Windows, which would otherwise cause the state machine to be corrupted and require the machine to be rebooted.
The events raised by this component occur only during a dialing operation, if you need to monitor connection changes made outside of dialing a connection use the component.

list.item: Due to limitations with Windows, RasDialer cannot handle expired passwords or have the ability to change a password while connecting.
This component can only handle dialing one connection at a time. If your application needs to dial multiple connections simultaneously, use multiple instances of the component.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntry
member.summary: Represents a remote access service (RAS) entry. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks:
The methods exposed on this class typically require the entry to belong to a phone book before they can be called.
The static methods for creating entries on this object are not required to create an entry, however they do contain default information set by Windows for each platform.

member.remarks: This member is ignored if the is an empty string.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the number of seconds before additional subentries are connected.
member.remarks: This member is ignored unless sets the flag.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntry.HangUpExtraPercent

member.remarks: This member is ignored unless sets the flag.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntry.HangUpExtraSampleSeconds

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntry.IdleDisconnectSeconds

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions
member.summary: Represents options for a remote access service (RAS) entry. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.IPHeaderCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether IP header compression will be used on PPP (Point-to-Point) connections.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RemoteDefaultGateway
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote default gateway will be used.
member.remarks: This value corresponds to the Use default gateway on remote network checkbox in the TCP/IP settings dialog box.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.DisableLcpExtensions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service will disable the PPP LCP extensions.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.TerminateBeforeDial
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service displays a terminal window for user input before dialing the connection.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.TerminateAfterDial
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service displays a terminal window for user input after dialing the connection.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.ModemLights
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service will display a status monitor in the taskbar.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.SoftwareCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether software compression will be negotiated by the link.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireEncryptedPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether only secure password schemes can be used to authenticate the client.
member.remarks: This option corresponds to the Require Encrypted Password checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireMSEncryptedPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether only the Microsoft secure password scheme (MSCHAP) can be used to authenticate the client.
member.remarks: This option corresponds to the Require Microsoft Encrypted Password checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireDataEncryption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether data encryption must be negotiated successfully or the connection should be dropped.

remarks.para: This option corresponds to the Require Data Encryption checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.
This option is ignored unless the option is also set.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.NetworkLogOn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access service logs onto the network after the PPP (Point-to-Point) connection is established.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.UseLogOnCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access uses the currently logged on user credentials when dialing this entry.

remarks.para: This option corresponds to the Use Current Username and Password checkbox in the Security settings dialog box.
This option is ignored unless the option is also set.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.PromoteAlternates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether alternate numbers are promoted to the primary number when connected successfully.
member.remarks: This option corresponds to the Move successful numbers to the top of the list checkbox in the AlterNate Phone Numbers dialog box.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.SecureLocalFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an existing remote file system and remote printer bindings are located before making a connection.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireEap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequirePap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Password Authentication Protocol (PAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireSpap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Shiva's Password Authentication Protocol (SPAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.CustomEncryption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the connection will use custom encryption.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.PreviewPhoneNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display the phone number being dialed.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.SharedPhoneNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all modems on the computer will share the same phone number.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.PreviewUserPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display the username and password prior to dialing.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.PreviewDomain
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display the domain name prior to dialing.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.ShowDialingProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the remote access dialer should display its progress while establishing the connection.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireChap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireMSChap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (MSCHAP) must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireMSChap2
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (MSCHAP) version 2 must be supported for authentication.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasEntryOptions.RequireWin95MSChap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether MSCHAP must also send the LAN Manager hashed password.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Ras.RasPhoneBook
member.summary: Represents a remote access service (RAS) phone book. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: There are multiple phone books in use by Windows at any given point in time and this class can only manage one phone book per instance. If you add an entry to the all user's profile phone book, attempting to manipulate it with the current user's profile phone book opened will result in failure. Entries will not be located, and changes made to the phone book will not be recognized by the instance.

When attempting to open a phone book that does not yet exist, the RasPhoneBook class will automatically generate the file to be used. Also, setting the property to true will allow the class to monitor for any external changes made to the file.

list.item: For phone books which are not located in the all users profile directory (including those in custom locations) any stored credentials for the entries must be stored per user.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.DefaultSmppGateway
member.summary: Place holder SMPP gateway

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.DefaultSmppGateway.Bind
member.summary: Connects and binds the SMPP gateway to the SMSC, using the values that have been set in the constructor and through the properties. This will also start the timer that sends enquire_link packets at regular intervals, if it has been enabled.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.DefaultSmppGateway.Unbind
member.summary: Unbinds the SMPP gateway from the SMSC then disconnects the socket when it receives the unbind response from the SMSC. This will also stop the timer that sends out the enquire_link packets if it has been enabled. You need to explicitly call this to unbind.; it will not be done for you.

member.summary: Sends a user-specified Pdu(see the base library for Pdu types). This allows complete flexibility for sending Pdus.

member.summary: Clears the log file content

member.summary: The port on the SMSC to connect to.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.DefaultSmppGateway.EnquireLinkInterval
member.summary: Set to the number of seconds that should elapse in between enquire_link packets. Setting this to anything other than 0 will enable the timer, setting it to 0 will disable the timer. Note that the timer is only started/stopped during a bind/unbind. Negative values are ignored.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.DefaultSmppGateway.SleepTimeAfterSocketFailure
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds that the system will wait before trying to rebind after a total network failure(due to cable problems, etc). Negative values are ignored.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway
member.summary: SMPPP gateway interface

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.Bind
member.summary: Connects and binds the SMPP gateway to the SMSC, using the values that have been set in the constructor and through the properties. This will also start the timer that sends enquire_link packets at regular intervals, if it has been enabled.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.Unbind
member.summary: Unbinds the SMPP gateway from the SMSC then disconnects the socket when it receives the unbind response from the SMSC. This will also stop the timer that sends out the enquire_link packets if it has been enabled. You need to explicitly call this to unbind.; it will not be done for you.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.SendPdu(MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU)
member.summary: Sends a user-specified Pdu(see the base library for Pdu types). This allows complete flexibility for sending Pdus.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.Username
member.summary: The username to use for software validation.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.SentUnbindPacket
member.summary: Accessor to determine if we have sent the unbind packet out. Once the packet is sent, you can consider this object to be unbound.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.Port
member.summary: The port on the SMSC to connect to.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.BindType
member.summary: The binding type(receiver, transmitter, or transceiver)to use when connecting to the SMSC.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.SystemType
member.summary: The system type to use when connecting to the SMSC.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.SystemId
member.summary: The system ID to use when connecting to the SMSC. This is, in essence, a user name.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.Password
member.summary: The password to use when connecting to an SMSC.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.Host
member.summary: The host to bind this SMPP gateway to.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.NpiType
member.summary: The number plan indicator that this SMPP gateway should use.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.TonType
member.summary: The type of number that this SMPP gateway should use.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.Version
member.summary: The SMPP specification version to use.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.AddressRange
member.summary: The address range of this SMPP gateway.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.EnquireLinkInterval
member.summary: Set to the number of seconds that should elapse in between enquire_link packets. Setting this to anything other than 0 will enable the timer, setting it to 0 will disable the timer. Note that the timer is only started/stopped during a bind/unbind. Negative values are ignored.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.ISmppGateway.SleepTimeAfterSocketFailure
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds that the system will wait before trying to rebind after a total network failure(due to cable problems, etc). Negative values are ignored.

member.summary: Return the license associated with this software

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU
member.summary: Represents a protocol data unit. This class holds type enumerations and common functionality for request and response Pdus.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.HEADER_LENGTH
member.summary: Standard length of Pdu header.

member.name: F:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.DATE_TIME_LENGTH
member.summary: Delivery time length

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.PacketBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte response from the SMSC. This will return a clone of the byte array upon a "get" request.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.CommandLength
member.summary: Defines the overall length of the Pdu in octets(i.e. bytes).

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.SequenceNumber
member.summary: The sequence number of the message. Only call this after you call GetMSBHexEncoding; it will be incorrect otherwise. If you are setting the sequence number(such as for a deliver_sm_resp), set this before you call GetMSBHexEncoding. Note that setting the custom sequence number will disable the automatic updating of the sequence number for this instance. You can restore the automatic updating by setting this property to 0.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.CommandStatus
member.summary: Indicates outcome of request.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.CommandID
member.summary: The command ID of this Pdu.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for sent Pdus.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructor for received Pdus.
member.param: The incoming bytes to translate to a Pdu.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.InitPdu
member.summary: Initializes this Pdu. Override to add more functionality, but don't forget to call this one.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.ToMsbHexEncoding
member.summary: Gets the hex encoding(big-endian)of this Pdu.
member.return: The hex-encoded version of the Pdu

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.DecodeSmscResponse
member.summary: Decodes the bind response from the SMSC. This version throws a NotImplementedException.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.InsertLengthIntoPdu(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Calculates the length of the given ArrayList representation of the Pdu and inserts this length into the appropriate spot in the Pdu. This will call TrimToSize()on the ArrayList-the caller need not do it.
member.param: The protocol data unit to calculate the length for.
member.returns: The Pdu with the length inserted, trimmed to size.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.EncodePduForTransmission(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Takes the given Pdu, calculates its length(trimming it beforehand), inserting its length, and copying it to a byte array.
member.returns: The byte array representation of the Pdu.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.GetHostOrderUInt16FromTlv(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Retrieves the given bytes from the TLV table and converts them into a host order UInt16.
member.param: The TLV tag to use for retrieval

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.GetHostOrderUInt32FromTlv(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Retrieves the given bytes from the TLV table and converts them into a host order UInt32.
member.param: The TLV tag to use for retrieval

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.SetHostOrderValueIntoTlv(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Takes the given value and puts it into the TLV table, accounting for network byte ordering.
member.param: The TLV tag to use for retrieval
The value to put into the table

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.SetHostOrderValueIntoTlv(System.UInt16,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Takes the given value and puts it into the TLV table, accounting for network byte ordering.
member.param: The TLV tag to use for retrieval
The value to put into the table

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.BytesAfterHeader
member.summary: What remains after the header is stripped off the Pdu. Subclasses don't need the header as its information is stored here. In addition, this allows them to manipulate the response data all they want without destroying the original. The copying is done every time this property is accessed, so use caution in a high-performance setting.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.GetPduHeader
member.summary: Creates an ArrayList consisting of the Pdu header. Command ID and status need to be set before calling this.
member.returns: The Pdu as a trimmed ArrayList.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.GenerateSequenceNumber
member.summary: Generates a monotonically increasing sequence number for each Pdu. When it hits the the 32 bit unsigned int maximum, it starts over.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.GetOptionalParamString(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Gets the optional parameter string associated with the given tag.
member.returns: The optional parameter string, the empty string if not found.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.GetOptionalParamBytes(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Gets the optional parameter bytes associated with the given tag.
member.returns: The optional parameter bytes, null if not found.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.SetOptionalParamString(System.UInt16,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the given TLV(as a string)into the table. This ignores null values. This will reverse the byte order in the tag for you (necessary for encoding).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.SetOptionalParamBytes(System.UInt16,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the given TLV(as a byte array)into the table. This will not take care of big-endian/little-endian issues, although it will reverse the byte order in the tag for you(necessary for encoding). This ignores null values.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.UpdateOptionalParamBytes(System.UInt16,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Allows the updating of TLV values. This will not take care of big-endian/little-endian issues, although it will reverse the byte order in the tag for you(necessary for encoding).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.UpdateOptionalParamString(System.UInt16,System.String)
member.summary: Allows the updating of TLV values. This will reverse the byte order in the tag for you (necessary for encoding).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.TranslateTlvDataIntoTable(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Takes the given bytes and attempts to insert them into the TLV table.
member.param: The bytes to convert for the TLVs.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.TranslateTlvDataIntoTable(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes the given bytes and attempts to insert them into the TLV table.
member.param: The bytes to convert for the TLVs.
The index of the byte array to start at. This is here because in some instances you may not want to start at the beginning.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.AddTlvBytes(System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: Adds the TLV bytes to the given Pdu.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.TrimResponsePdu(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Trims the trailing zeroes off of the response Pdu. Useful for tracing and other purposes. This uses the command length to actually trim it down, so TLVs and strings are not lost. If the response actually is the same length as the command length, this method performs a pass-through.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.DecodeCommandId(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Utility method to allow the Pdu factory to decode the command ID without knowing about packet structure. Some SMSCs combine response packets(even though they shouldn't).
member.returns: The ID of the Pdu command(e.g. cancel_sm_resp).

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.DecodeCommandLength(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Utility method to allow the Pdu factory to decode the command length without knowing about packet structure. Some SMSCs combine response packets(even though they shouldn't).
member.returns: The length of the Pdu command.

member.summary: Limit of short message.

member.summary: The priority level of the message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.ScheduleDeliveryTime
member.summary: Scheduled delivery time for the message delivery. Set to null for immediate delivery. Otherwise, use YYMMDDhhmmsstnn as the format. See section 7.1.1 of the SMPP spec for more details.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.ValidityPeriod
member.summary: The validity period of this message. Set to null to request the SMSC default validity period. Otherwise, use YYMMDDhhmmsstnn as the format. See section 7.1.1 of the SMPP spec for more details.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.ReplaceIfPresentFlag
member.summary: Flag indicating if submitted message should replace an existing message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.SmDefaultMessageId
member.summary: Allows use of a canned message from the SMSC. If not using an SMSC canned message, set to 0.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.ShortMessage
member.summary: The short message to send, up to 160 octets. If you need more length, use the MessagePayload property. Do not use both at the same time! Setting this to null will result in an empty string. This can be either a string or a byte array; anything else will result in an exception.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.SmLength
member.summary: The length of the short message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.#ctor
member.summary: Groups construction tasks for subclasses. Sets source address TON to international, source address NPI to ISDN, source address to "", registered delivery type to none, ESM class to 0, data coding to SMSC default, protocol ID to v3.4, priority to level 1, validity period to default, replace if present to false, default message ID to 0, and the short message to an empty string.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new MessageLcd2 for incoming PDUs.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd2.GetBytesAfterDestination
member.summary: Creates the bytes after the destination address bytes. This also inserts the TLV table data. Common to both submit and submit multiple.
member.returns: The bytes in the Pdu before the destination address(es).

member.summary: The application port number associated with the source address of the message. This parameter should be present for WAP applications.

member.summary: The reference number for a particular concatenated short message. Both SarTotalSegments and SarSegmentSeqnum need to be set in conjunction with this property. In addition, this must be the same for each segment.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.SarTotalSegments
member.summary: Indicates the total number of short messages within the concatenated short message. Both SarMsgRefNumber and SarSegmentSeqNum need to be set in conjunction with this property. In addition, this must be the same for each segment.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.SarSegmentSeqnum
member.summary: The sequence number of a particular short message within the concatenated short message. Both SarMsgRefNumber and SarTotalSegments need to be set in conjunction with this property.

member.summary: Defines the type of payload.

member.summary: Contains the extended short message user data. Up to 64K octets can be transmitted. The limit for this is network/SMSC dependent.

member.summary: The privacy level of the message.

member.summary: Allows an indication to be provided to an MS that there are messages waiting for the subscriber on systems on the PLMN. The indication can be an icon on the MS screen or other MMI indication. See section 5.3.2.13 for details on how to set this.

member.summary: Provides a MS with validity information associated with the received short message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.AlertOnMsgDelivery
member.summary:
Tells a mobile station to alert the user when the short message arrives at the MS.
Note: there is no value part associated with this parameter. Any value you pass in will be discarded.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.LanguageIndicator
member.summary: The language of the short message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.DisplayTime
member.summary: Associates a display time with the short message on the MS.

member.summary: Associates a call back number with the message. See section 5.3.2.36 of the SMPP spec for details. This must be between 4 and 19 characters in length.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.CallbackNumPresInd
member.summary: Controls the presentation indication and screening of the CallBackNumber at the mobile station. You must also use the callback_num parameter with this. See section 5.3.2.37 of the SMPP spec for details in how to set this.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.CallbackNumAtag
member.summary: Alphanumeric display tag for call back number. This must be less than or equal to 65 characters in length.

member.summary: Specifies a subaddress associated with the originator of the message. See section 5.3.2.15 of the SMPP spec for details on setting this parameter.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.MessageLcd3.DestinationSubaddress
member.summary: Specifies a subaddress associated with the receiver of the message. See section 5.3.2.15 of the SMPP spec for details on setting this parameter.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppCancelSm
member.summary:
Cancels one or more previous short messages. A particular message or all messages for a particular source, destination and service_type can be cancelled.
From the SMPP spec: If the message_id is set to the ID of a previously submitted message, then provided the source address supplied by the ESME matches that of the stored message, that message will be cancelled. If the message_id is null, all outstanding undelivered messages with matching source and destination addresses given in the Pdu are cancelled. If provided, service_type is included in this matching. Where the original submit_sm, data_sm or submit_multi source address was defaulted to null, then the source address in the cancel_sm command should also be null.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppCancelSm.MessageId
member.summary: Message ID of the message to be cancelled. This must be the SMSC assigned Message ID of the original message. Set to null if cancelling a group of messages.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppCancelSm.ServiceType
member.summary: Set to indicate SMS Application service, if cancellation of a group of application service messages is desired. Otherwise set to null.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppCancelSm.DestinationAddressTon
member.summary: Type of number of destination SME address of the message(s)to be cancelled. This must match that supplied in the original message submission request. This can be set to null if the message ID is provided.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppCancelSm.DestinationAddressNpi
member.summary: Numbering Plan Indicator of destination SME address of the message(s))to be cancelled. This must match that supplied in the original message submission request. This can be set to null when the message ID is provided.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppCancelSm.DestinationAddress
member.summary: Destination address of message(s)to be cancelled. This must match that supplied in the original message submission request. This can be set to null when the message ID is provided.

member.summary: Creates an SMPP Cancel SM Pdu. Sets message ID and service type to empty strings (null), sets the destination TON to international and the destination NPI to ISDN, and sets the command status to 0.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.ServiceType
member.summary: Used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message. If this is unknown, null is returned.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SourceAddressTon
member.summary: Type of Number for source address.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SourceAddressNpi
member.summary: Numbering Plan Indicator for source address.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SourceAddress
member.summary: Address of origination entity.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.DestinationAddressTon
member.summary: Type of number of destination entity.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.DestinationAddressNpi
member.summary: Numbering Plan Indicator of destination entity.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.DestinationAddress
member.summary: Destination address of entity.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.EsmClass
member.summary: Indicates Message Mode and Message Type. See the SMSC version 3.4 specification for details on this.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.ProtocolId
member.summary: Protocol Identifier; network specific.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.PriorityFlag
member.summary: Designates the priority level of the message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.RegisteredDelivery
member.summary: Use this to indicate if you want delivery confirmation.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.DataCoding
member.summary: Indicates the encoding scheme of the short message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SmLength
member.summary: Short message length in octets(bytes for x86).

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.ShortMessage
member.summary: The short message for this Pdu. This holds up to 160 characters. If the message is longer, the MessagePayload property will be used. If this is the case, the short message length will be zero. Note that both the ShortMessage and MessagePayload cannot be used simultaneously.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.UserMessageReference
member.summary: The message reference number assigned by the ESME.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SourcePort
member.summary: The port number associated with the source address of the message. This parameter will be present for WAP applications.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.DestinationPort
member.summary: The port number associated with the destination address of the message. This parameter will be present for WAP applications.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SarMsgRefNumber
member.summary: The reference number for a particular concatenated short message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SarTotalSegments
member.summary: Total number of short message fragments within the concatenated short message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SarSegmentSeqnum
member.summary: The sequence number of a particular short message fragment within the concatenated short message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.UserResponseCode
member.summary: A user response code. The actual response codes are SMS application specific.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.PrivacyIndicator
member.summary: Indicates a level of privacy associated with the message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.PayloadType
member.summary: Defines the type of payload(e.g. WDP, WCMP, etc.)

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.MessagePayload
member.summary: This can hold up to 64K octets of short message data. The actual limit is network/SMSC dependent.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.CallbackNum
member.summary: Associates a callback number with a message. See section 5.3.2.36 of the SMPP spec for details. This must be between 4 and 19 characters in length.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.SourceSubaddress
member.summary: Specifies a source subaddress associated with the originating entity. See section 5.3.2.15 of the SMPP spec for details on setting this parameter.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.DestinationSubaddress
member.summary: Specifies a source subaddress associated with the receiving entity. See section 5.3.2.15 of the SMPP spec for details on setting this parameter.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.LanguageIndicator
member.summary: The language of the short message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.ItsSessionInfo
member.summary:
From the SMPP spec: The its_session_info parameter is a required parameter for the CDMA Interactive Teleservice as defined by the Korean PCS carriers [KORITS]. It contains control information for the interactive session between an MS and an ESME.
See section 5.3.2.43 of the SMPP spec for how to set this.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.NetworkErrorCode
member.summary: Network Error Code. May be present for Intermediate Notifications and SMSC Delivery Receipts. See SMPP spec 5.3.2.31 for details.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.MessageState
member.summary: Indicates to the ESME the final message state for an SMSC Delivery Receipt.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppDeliverSm.ReceiptedMessageId
member.summary: Indicates the ID of the message being receipted in an SMSC Delivery Receipt.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm
member.summary: Pdu to replace a previously submitted short message that hasn't been delivered. The match is based on the message_id and source addresses of the original message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.MessageId
member.summary: SMSC message ID of the message to be replaced. This must be the message ID of the original message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.ScheduleDeliveryTime
member.summary: New scheduled delivery time for the short message. Set to null, if updating of the original scheduled delivery time is not desired.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.ValidityPeriod
member.summary: New expiration time for the short message. Set to null, if updating of the original expiration time is not required.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.SmDefaultMessageId
member.summary: New pre-defined(canned)message identifier. Set to 0 if not using.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.ShortMessage
member.summary: New short message to replace existing message.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.SmLength
member.summary: The length of the short message.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a replace_sm Pdu. Sets source address TON to international, source address NPI to ISDN, source address to "", registered delivery type to none, message ID, scheduled delivery time, validity period, and short message to empty strings(NULL SMSC value). Sets the default message ID to 0.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a replace_sm Pdu. Sets source address TON to international, source address NPI to ISDN, source address to "", registered delivery type to none, message ID, scheduled delivery time, validity period, and short message to empty strings(NULL SMSC value). Sets the default message ID to 0.
member.param: The incoming bytes from an ESME.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.InitPdu
member.summary: Initializes this Pdu.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.ToMsbHexEncoding
member.summary: Generates the hex encoded bytes for a replace_sm Pdu.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppReplaceSm.DecodeSmscResponse
member.summary: This decodes the submit_sm Pdu. The Pdu has basically the same format as the submit_sm Pdu, but in this case it is a response.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti
member.summary: Defines a submit_multi Pdu.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti.NumberOfDestinations
member.summary: The number of destinations to send to.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti.DestinationAddresses
member.summary: The destination addresses that will be sent to. This will set the number of destination addresses as well. Passing null in will set them to zero. Calling the accessor will get you a cloned array. You must use the mutator to modify the values.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a submit_multi Pdu. Sets source address TON to international, source address NPI to ISDN, source address to "", registered delivery type to none, ESM class to 0, data coding to SMSC default, protocol ID to v3.4, priority to level 1, validity period to default, replace if present to false, default message ID to 0, the short message to an empty string, the number of destinations to 0 and the destination addresses to null. Use the DestAddrFactory class to create destination addresses.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a submit_multi Pdu. Sets source address TON to international, source address NPI to ISDN, source address to "", registered delivery type to none, ESM class to 0, data coding to SMSC default, protocol ID to v3.4, priority to level 1, validity period to default, replace if present to false, default message ID to 0, the short message to an empty string, the number of destinations to 0 and the destination addresses to null. Use the DestAddrFactory class to create destination addresses.
member.param: The incoming bytes from an ESME

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti.InitPdu
member.summary: Initializes this Pdu.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti.ToMsbHexEncoding
member.summary: Gets the hex encoding(big-endian)of this Pdu.
member.return: The hex-encoded version of the Pdu

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitMulti.DecodeSmscResponse
member.summary: Decodes the submit_multi response from the SMSC.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm
member.summary: Defines an SMPP submit request.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.DestinationAddressTon
member.summary: Type of Number for destination.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.DestinationAddressNpi
member.summary: Numbering Plan Indicator for destination.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.DestinationAddress
member.summary: Destination address of this short message. Null values will be converted to an empty string.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.MoreMessagesToSend
member.summary: Indicates to the SMSC that there are further messages for the same destination.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.UserResponseCode
member.summary:
A response code set by the user in a User Acknowledgement/Reply message. The response codes are application specific. From the SMPP spec:
0 to 255(IS-95 CDMA) 0 to 15(CMT-136 TDMA)

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.NumberOfMessages
member.summary: Used to indicate the number of messages stored in a mailbox.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.ItsReplyType
member.summary: From the SMPP spec: The its_reply_type parameter is a required parameter for the CDMA Interactive Teleservice as defined by the Korean PCS carriers [KORITS]. It indicates and controls the MS users reply method to an SMS delivery message received from the ESME.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.ItsSessionInfo
member.summary:
From the SMPP spec: The its_session_info parameter is a required parameter for the CDMA Interactive Teleservice as defined by the Korean PCS carriers [KORITS]. It contains control information for the interactive session between an MS and an ESME.
See section 5.3.2.43 of the SMPP spec for how to set this.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.UssdServiceOp
member.summary:
From the SMPP spec: The ussd_service_op parameter is required to define the USSD service operation when SMPP is being used as an interface to a(GSM)USSD system.
See 5.3.2.44 of the SMPP spec for how to set this.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.Request.SmppSubmitSm.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a submit Pdu. Sets source address TON to international, source address NPI to ISDN, source address to "", registered delivery type to none, ESM class to 0, data coding to SMSC default, protocol ID to v3.4, priority to level 1, validity period to default, replace if present to false, default message ID to 0, the short message to an empty string, the destination address TON to international, destination address NPI to ISDN, the destination address to "", the command status to 0, and the Command ID to submit_sm.

member.summary: Creates a new SmppSubmitSm for incoming PDUs.

member.summary: Initializes this Pdu.

member.summary: Gets the hex encoding(big-endian)of this Pdu.
member.return: The hex-encoded version of the Pdu

member.summary: This decodes the submit_sm Pdu. The Pdu has basically the same format as the submit_sm Pdu, but in this case it is a response.

member.name: T:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway
member.summary: Wrapper class to provide asynchronous I/O for the SMPP library. Note that most SMPP events have default handlers. If the events are overridden by the caller by adding event handlers, it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the proper response is sent. For example: there is a default deliver_sm_resp implemented. If you "listen" to the deliver_sm event, it is your responsibility to then send the deliver_sm_resp packet.

member.summary: The address range of this SMPP gateway.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway.EnquireLinkInterval
member.summary: Set to the number of seconds that should elapse in between enquire_link packets. Setting this to anything other than 0 will enable the timer, setting it to 0 will disable the timer. Note that the timer is only started/stopped during a bind/unbind. Negative values are ignored.

member.name: P:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway.SleepTimeAfterSocketFailure
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds that the system will wait before trying to rebind after a total network failure(due to cable problems, etc). Negative values are ignored.

member.summary: Number of retry after socket failure

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Creates a default SMPP gateway, with port 9999, bindtype set to transceiver, host set to localhost, NPI type set to ISDN, TON type set to International, version set to 3.4, enquire link interval set to 0(disabled), sleep time after socket failure set to 10 seconds, and address range, password, system type and system ID set to null (no value).
member.param: The container that will hold this component.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default SMPP gateway, with port 9999, bindtype set to transceiver, host set to localhost, NPI type set to ISDN, TON type set to International, version set to 3.4, enquire link interval set to 0(disabled), sleep time after socket failure set to 10 seconds, and address range, password, system type and system ID set to null (no value).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway.SendPdu(MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU)
member.summary: Sends a user-specified Pdu(see the base library for Pdu types). This allows complete flexibility for sending Pdus.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway.Bind
member.summary: Connects and binds the SMPP gateway to the SMSC, using the values that have been set in the constructor and through the properties. This will also start the timer that sends enquire_link packets at regular intervals, if it has been enabled.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.SmppGateway.Unbind
member.summary: Unbinds the SMPP gateway from the SMSC then disconnects the socket when it receives the unbind response from the SMSC. This will also stop the timer that sends out the enquire_link packets if it has been enabled. You need to explicitly call this to unbind.; it will not be done for you.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Utility.SmppStringUtil.GetStringFromBody(System.Byte[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next string from the given byte array. Note: this method also trims off the string from the byte array, so that it can be easily used in subsequent operations. You have to know the string length; this will not look for a null character(as it is meant to be used with non-null terminated strings).
member.param: The byte array to pull the string from. This should not contain extraneous data.
The index to start getting the string from. Usually zero.
The index to end at. The character at this index will not be included.

member.name: M:MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Utility.SmppStringUtil.GetStringFromBody(System.Byte[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32,MessagingToolkit.Core.Smpp.Packet.PDU.DataCodingType)

The index to end at. The character at this index will not be included.

member.param: The byte array to pull the string from. This should not contain extraneous data.
